commit_message:
Fix job_binaries deletion

This fix adding check for job binaries urls that beggins with 'swift://swift://'
Please, note that it affects only stable/liberty because in current
master sahara-dashboard was moved to separate repo.
Also same fix was merged to sahara-dashboard master:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/255286/

Closes-bug: 1509121
Change-Id: I67b55de0cfcf478eefbdae7f1f01f458f95d2f22

commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run

Because python creates pyc|pyo files and __pycache__
directories during tox runs, certain changes in the tree,
like deletes of files, or switching branches, can create
spurious errors.

Change-Id: Ibaac514521bab11bbf552e0310d1203230c0d984
Closes-Bug: #1368661

commit_message:
Enable os_inherit of Keystone v3 API

os_inherit extension has been implemented since 2 years ago, and the
API doc[1] also contains it. However os_inherit extension is disabled
on Keystone v3 API. So it is nice to enable the extension for the
development and testing.
This patch comes from the discussion[2].

[1]: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-identity-v3-ext.html#identity_v3_OS-INHERIT-ext
[2]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/081822.html

Change-Id: Ic5f87a7c7081b95d81e2710b839207c907cf3de3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/85/257085/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $KEYSTONE_CONF os_inherit enabled "True"

added_lines: def test_del_no_children_allowed(self): fs = impl_memory.FakeFilesystem() fs['/a'] = 'a' self.assertEqual(1, len(fs.ls_r("/"))) fs.delete("/a") self.assertEqual(0, len(fs.ls("/"))) def test_del_many_children_not_allowed(self): fs = impl_memory.FakeFilesystem() fs['/a'] = 'a' fs['/a/b'] = 'b' self.assertRaises(ValueError, fs.delete, "/", recursive=True) self.assertRaises(ValueError, self._del_item_path, fs, '/') def test_del_many_children_allowed(self): fs = impl_memory.FakeFilesystem() fs['/a'] = 'a' fs['/a/b'] = 'b' self.assertEqual(2, len(fs.ls_r("/"))) fs.delete("/a", recursive=True) self.assertEqual(0, len(fs.ls("/")))

When we use 'qemu-img info' command to get image info, some kinds

$qemu-img info sheepdog:volume-1af1afa0-7820-4063-9b90-4fa6161a74a9

commit_message:
Fix the bug of can't get the desired image info

When we use 'qemu-img info' command to get image info, some kinds
of image may show an 'unavailable' disk size. For example:
$qemu-img info sheepdog:volume-1af1afa0-7820-4063-9b90-4fa6161a74a9
image: sheepdog:volume-1af1afa0-7820-4063-9b90-4fa6161a74a9
file format: raw
virtual size: 10G (10737418240 bytes)
disk size: unavailable
$qemu-img info -f rbd rbd:data/foo
image: rbd:data/foo
file format: rbd
virtual size: 10G (10737418240 bytes)
disk size: unavailable
cluster_size: 4194304
The current code didn't consider 'unavailable' size, and it will
raise a ValueError in this case. This patch fixed this bug by
adding the judgment of 'unavailable' size.

Closes-Bug: #1516083
(cherry picked from commit Ic5f3b80e172baaafc07432319f8aa24bf117b392)

Change-Id: I4b7ca3e45dc65dc579dd335811b9791c5a14dc9c

commit_message:
Change CLI related to config

We proposed "config-verify" as the command, but the other command
"run-stress" already exists and we need to change this command for
the consistency of CLI.
If8afab441f51e5cf0f3bf1e2b95d76b2c1d0c474 implements the CLI on
new CLI name.

Change-Id: I8a96af900362b81b9a24545bd5962e8e38f0a926

subject: Fix pylint/astroid breakage
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 02:24:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas/commit/4bf3507ea8814bd834e736ddab6274627cb4774b', 'message': 'Pin pylint and astroid

The astroid package, a dependency for pylint, is floating, and the latest
versions (1.4.0 and 1.4.1) are broken, when used with python 1.4.4. This
fix pins pylint to 1.4.4 and astroid to 1.3.8 - previously known working
versions.

Later, python 1.5.0 and astroid 1.4.1 can be analyzed, and if selected,
code can be udpated to pass pylint, as there are some new errors that
will occur with the newer versions.

In addition, the constraint based pep8 job could be used to prevent this
version incompatibility, as it pins astroid to 1.3.8 (and global
requirements pins pylint to 1.4.4).

An upstream bug for astroid has been raised for the incompatibility.

Change-Id: I91492a1ca0ba9c35b54f5a0ae4a24e04692dcf44
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-01 15:47:36.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas/commit/a3b3842bc0d2528bc34580563eb089db8d9a5d5d', 'message': 'Fix pylint/astroid breakage

Found that pylint 1.5.0 and astroid 1.4.1 generate new errors for pylint
testing. Also, if pin pylint to 1.4.4, which is done in neutron, will have
breakage, because pylint 1.4.4 is not compatible with astroid 1.4.x.

For now, fix is to pin these two in tox.ini to pylint 1.4.4 and astroid
1.3.8.

Later, can implement pep8-constraints job and target for VPN repo, and
that will handle the constraints.

In long term, can migrate to pylint 1.5.0 and resolve the warnings/errors
that crop up. Note: looks like the fixes are not backwards compatible.
Will see if this commit will force pep8 job to use the "right" versions.

Change-Id: I91492a1ca0ba9c35b54f5a0ae4a24e04692dcf44
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pylint/astroid breakage

Found that pylint 1.5.0 and astroid 1.4.1 generate new errors for pylint
testing. Also, if pin pylint to 1.4.4, which is done in neutron, will have
breakage, because pylint 1.4.4 is not compatible with astroid 1.4.x.

For now, fix is to pin these two in tox.ini to pylint 1.4.4 and astroid
1.3.8.

Later, can implement pep8-constraints job and target for VPN repo, and
that will handle the constraints.

In long term, can migrate to pylint 1.5.0 and resolve the warnings/errors
that crop up. Note: looks like the fixes are not backwards compatible.
Will see if this commit will force pep8 job to use the "right" versions.

Change-Id: I91492a1ca0ba9c35b54f5a0ae4a24e04692dcf44

commit_message:
Add release note for config group change

Change-Id: Ica0bf538e98b85ab27803d1350bf3ca4d4ba7827
Partial-Bug: #1493975
Co-Authored-By: Itisha Dewan <ishadewan07@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/50/255650/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: > Config options for searchlight-api and searchlight-listener are grouped under config groups [api] and [listener]. upgrade: - Options 'bind_host', 'bind_port', 'backlog', 'tcp_keepidle', 'ca_file', 'cert_file', 'key_file', 'workers', 'max_header_line' and 'http_keepalive' are moved to [api] group. Options 'listener_workers' is renamed to 'workers' and moved to [listener] group. Options 'host' and 'http_timeout' are removed since they are not currently used anywhere. fixes: - The workers for listener was always 1, so config listener_workers was not work as expected. Now operators can set 'workers' under group [listener] to running multiple listener processes.

subject: Changed the key repo validation to allow read only
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-11 20:35:48.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/cmd/cli.py', 'keystone/token/providers/fernet/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/0aaa3ab1710c3bd9ca7800cc2156a483bd463a11', 'message': 'Changed the key repo validation to allow read only

Fernet token operations would fail if the key respository did not
have write access, even though it would only need read access.
Added logic to validation to only check for read or read/write
access based on what is required.

Change-Id: I1ac8c3bd549055d5a13e0f5785dede42d710cf9d
Closes-Bug: 1523664
'}]
commit_message:
Changed the key repo validation to allow read only

Fernet token operations would fail if the key respository did not
have write access, even though it would only need read access.
Added logic to validation to only check for read or read/write
access based on what is required.

Change-Id: I1ac8c3bd549055d5a13e0f5785dede42d710cf9d
Closes-Bug: 1523664
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/36/256736/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def validate_key_repository(requires_write=False): # ensure current user has sufficient access to the key repository is_valid = (os.access(CONF.fernet_tokens.key_repository, os.R_OK) and os.access(CONF.fernet_tokens.key_repository, os.X_OK)) if requires_write: is_valid = (is_valid and os.access(CONF.fernet_tokens.key_repository, os.W_OK)) if not is_valid: else: # ensure the key repository isn't world-readable stat_info = os.stat(CONF.fernet_tokens.key_repository) if(stat_info.st_mode & stat.S_IROTH or stat_info.st_mode & stat.S_IXOTH): LOG.warning(_LW( '[fernet_tokens] key_repository is world readable: %s'), CONF.fernet_tokens.key_repository) return is_valid
deleted_lines: def validate_key_repository(): # ensure current user has full access to the key repository if (not os.access(CONF.fernet_tokens.key_repository, os.R_OK) or not os.access(CONF.fernet_tokens.key_repository, os.W_OK) or not os.access(CONF.fernet_tokens.key_repository, os.X_OK)): return False # ensure the key repository isn't world-readable stat_info = os.stat(CONF.fernet_tokens.key_repository) if stat_info.st_mode & stat.S_IROTH or stat_info.st_mode & stat.S_IXOTH: LOG.warning(_LW( '[fernet_tokens] key_repository is world readable: %s'), CONF.fernet_tokens.key_repository) return True

commit_message:
Move related options to group 'api'

Currently, the number of api workers is configed by option 'workers'
which is obscure. Move it and related api related options to group
'api'.

Change-Id: I77c450f74d19b3faf0fefc663abfebbb3cd1ea06
Partial-Bug: #1493975

commit_message:
Fix StrOpts with integer defaults

A couple config options sneaked in defined as strings but
really expecting integer values. This causes errors with the
latest oslo.config that expects the appropriate type.

This patch changes these instances to be the expected IntOpt.

Change-Id: I449c1f0057d6f4afabfb8b71040427dbcb0ca4ee

commit_message:
Initial patch for Trircle stateless architecture(XJob)

Initial patch to implement the framework of Tricircle, this is
the part for XJob, establish rpc connection to message bus, and one
sample rpc call 'testrpc' from Nova-APIGW.

Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tricircle/+spec/implement-stateless

Change-Id: I8e538de187c075ad06e090edb7061ae6caa1deda
Signed-off-by: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>

This reverts commit a67394a05872c89699487fc3e1e6a1801a7714c2.

It seems to break heat grenade job. I can use this commit to verify that.

commit_message:
Allow specifying which policy file to use for keystone

To allow testing policy scenarios that are a bit more advanced than the
default we need to allow users and the gate to specify a policy file
other than the default.

Change-Id: I7bf225f2d6a338caab4b48ae6125f33c33c007bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/65/244965/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: KEYSTONE_POLICY_FILE=${KEYSTONE_POLICY_FILE:-$KEYSTONE_CONF_DIR/policy.json} cp -p $KEYSTONE_DIR/etc/policy.v3cloudsample.json $KEYSTONE_CONF_DIR iniset $KEYSTONE_CONF oslo_policy policy_file "$KEYSTONE_POLICY_FILE"

commit_message:
docs: update old stuff in version section

The concept doc should only talk about v2.1 API. This pach corrects them.
Also use the current API response instead of the old one and correct some
old reference link.

blueprint complete-todo-in-api-concept-doc

Change-Id: I90b39959a6a13f37ec0c03cf6f86943eba6c47d1

commit_message:
Improve inject_nmi() in libvirt driver and add tests.

Commit d0ee3ab01dccebdf78fc7cb71ed92f617d596540 added an driver API
to libvirt driver to support injecting NMI into an instance. This
API is mainly used to trigger crash dump in instance.

The previous patch didn't add unit tests. And the error handling
is also not enough.

This patch adds unit tests for this API, and improve error handling
in this API.

Change-Id: I9aa30c516c33ca4418f2442da0dbd2670deefc06
Implements: blueprint instance-crash-dump
Signed-off-by: Hironori Shiina <shiina.hironori@jp.fujitsu.com>
Signed-off-by: Tang Chen <tangchen@cn.fujitsu.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/94/208794/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_inject_nmi(self): mock_guest = mock.Mock(libvirt_guest.Guest, id=1) instance = objects.Instance(uuid='fake-uuid', id=1) with mock.patch.object(self.drvr._host, 'get_guest', return_value=mock_guest): self.drvr.inject_nmi(instance) def test_inject_nmi_not_running(self): ex = fakelibvirt.make_libvirtError( fakelibvirt.libvirtError, 'Requested operation is not valid: domain is not running', error_code=fakelibvirt.VIR_ERR_OPERATION_INVALID) mock_guest = mock.Mock(libvirt_guest.Guest, id=1) mock_guest.inject_nmi = mock.Mock(side_effect=ex) instance = objects.Instance(uuid='fake-uuid', id=1) with mock.patch.object(self.drvr._host, 'get_guest', return_value=mock_guest): self.assertRaises(exception.InstanceNMIFailure, self.drvr.inject_nmi, instance) def test_inject_nmi_not_supported(self): ex = fakelibvirt.make_libvirtError( fakelibvirt.libvirtError, '', error_code=fakelibvirt.VIR_ERR_NO_SUPPORT) mock_guest = mock.Mock(libvirt_guest.Guest, id=1) mock_guest.inject_nmi = mock.Mock(side_effect=ex) instance = objects.Instance(uuid='fake-uuid', id=1) with mock.patch.object(self.drvr._host, 'get_guest', return_value=mock_guest): self.assertRaises(exception.NMINotSupported, self.drvr.inject_nmi, instance) def test_inject_nmi_other_error(self): ex = fakelibvirt.make_libvirtError( fakelibvirt.libvirtError, 'Error', error_code=fakelibvirt.VIR_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR) mock_guest = mock.Mock(libvirt_guest.Guest, id=1) mock_guest.inject_nmi = mock.Mock(side_effect=ex) instance = objects.Instance(uuid='fake-uuid', id=1) with mock.patch.object(self.drvr._host, 'get_guest', return_value=mock_guest): self.assertRaises(exception.InstanceNMIFailure, self.drvr.inject_nmi, instance)

Add separated section for configure guest os

We have multiple concepts for configuring guest os. This patch
adds separated section for them, just like the 'move servers' section.

blueprint complete-todo-in-api-concept-doc

deleted_lines: - **User data** A user data file is a special key in the metadata service that holds a file that cloud-aware applications in the server can access. Nova has two ways to send user data to the deploying instance, one is by metadata service to let server able to connect to its metadata through a predefined ip address (169.254.169.254), then other is to use config drive which will wrap metadata into a iso9660 or vfat format disk so that the new deployed server can consume it by active engines such as cloud-init during its boot process.

commit_message:
Liberty: move the unimplemented specs to Mitaka

There are a few specs that were approved in direction during the Liberty
timeframe however, due to lack of developer bandwidth they did not merge
in the milestones for Liberty.

This commit moves those specs and puts them under the Mitaka approved
specs subfolder. Given these specs were approved in direction and have
not had concerned raised, we support them to be approved in Mitaka and
code implementation be allowed henceforth.

This commit also makes the appropriate changes to the index to
accomodate the new sub-folders.

This commit also removes the index for empty directory implemented under
specs/mitaka folder. The document builder fails while trying to find
documents under this empty directory. We should add the index back when
we have documents to be added under this directory.

Change-Id: I4053050cf3d5785dac1cb6f4ae27aa03795a634e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/53/231553/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove start_service calls from the test case

Currently in nova.tests.unit.network.test_manager.AllocateTestCase
start_service have been used to start nova compute and network services.
But these calls takes most of the time while running the test cases. In
this patch start_service method calls are removed to make test cases run
fast.

Change-Id: I908dc6007d66c482254f07c035e948daff2319f1
Closes-Bug: #1357751

commit_message:
Cache SecurityGroupAPI results from neutron multiplexer

On a normal run of the multinode grenade job, the n-api service alone
creates nova.compute.api.SecurityGroupAPI object 183 times. This patch
caches the object after the first creation. Since there are two ways
one can instantiate that API, we cache each independently, dropping the
count from 183 to 2.

Change-Id: I0932c652fb455fe10239215a93e183ea947234e3

commit_message:
Add Searchlight.service OPTS to list opts

Running the config generator as described in the dev env setup [0]
instructions does not include all the options for the service.
This adds those options.

[0] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/searchlight/dev-environment.html

Change-Id: I3296a6de8cb1eb4e25fee59245e21a6fe2e949ed
Closes-Bug: #1523639

commit_message:
Set listener workers according to config

Currently, the get_workers method always return 1, so config
listener_workers will never work as expected. This patch adds
the ability to specify number of workers for listener service.
The default is equal to the number of CPUs available.
Also, register searchlight.service.OPTS to group 'listener' in
searchlight.listener.
Remove not used options 'host' and 'http_timeout'.

Change-Id: Ifc39d5eaab1a7b0239631aa1b2b6e0af3a07f0c9
Closes-bug: #1522737
Closes-bug: #1523639

commit_message:
Handle the case that stack has no "outputs"

Object "stack" returned by Heat doesn't necessary have the "outputs"
attribute. This could happen when a stack is in failure state. Magnum
needs to handle this case robustly.

Closes-Bug: #1525678
Change-Id: I288af63bd9e2704f9869f3eaf8d8d4c6495a7973
